Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
ph2off - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: PH2OFF Process
Screen.Label: Convert Tau-Ph gathers to Time-Offset gathers
P_OFFSET_HDR=
P_INIT =
OFF_INIT=
P_INC =
OFF_INC=
P_LAST =
OFF_LAST=
P_TOT =
OFF_TOT=

Help.Tip: Whether to use P values from offset header or user defined.
Help.Text:
ph2off - P_OFFSET_HDR
Whether to use P values from offset header or user defined.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES/NO
 If P_OFFSET_HDR = YES, then use P values from header word 6.
 If P_OFFSET_HDR = NO,  then user needs to define P-value ranges.

Help.Tip: First input P value.
Help.Text:
ph2off - P_INIT
First input P value.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 
 Note: P-value units are MICROseconds/distance.

Help.Tip: First output offset.
Help.Text:
ph2off - OFF_INIT
First output offset.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment of input p-values
Help.Text:
ph2off - P_INC
Increment of input p-values
 
 Default = 5.0
 Allowed = real >= 0.0

Help.Tip: output offset increment.
Help.Text:
ph2off - OFF_INC
output offset increment.
 
 Default = 25.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Last input P value.
Help.Text:
ph2off - P_LAST
Last input P value.
 
 Default = P_INC * (NUMTR-1)
 Allowed = real
 
 Note: P-value units are MICROseconds/distance.

Help.Tip: Last output offset.
Help.Text:
ph2off - OFF_LAST
Last output offset.
 
 Default = OFF_INC * (NUMTR-1)
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Total number of input P-values.
Help.Text:
ph2off - P_TOT
Total number of input P-values.
 
 Default = NUMTR
 Allowed = int > 0

Help.Tip: Total number of output offsets.
Help.Text:
ph2off - OFF_TOT
Total number of output offsets.
 
 Default = NUMTR
 Allowed = int > 0

Help.Tip: Select velocity file path name.
Help.Text:
ph2off - SELECT_PATH_VEL
Select velocity file path name.
 
 Default = None
 Allowed = Character
 Allowed = Character

Help.Tip: velocity file path name.
Help.Text:
ph2off - PATH_VEL
velocity file path name.
 
 Default = None
 Allowed = Character
 Allowed = Character

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_VEL.
Help.Text:
ph2off - PATH_VEL_INFO
Status of PATH_VEL.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
ph2off - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
ph2off - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
ph2off - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
ph2off - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
ph2off - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
ph2off - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
ph2off - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
ph2off - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
ph2off - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
ph2off - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
ph2off - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : PH2OFF
 Category   : transforms
 Written    : 2003-05-06   by: Stephen Chiu
 Revised    : 2006-10-16   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Convert Tau-Ph gathers to Time-Offset gathers
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : Yes
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 This process is equivalent to PHXH module in APSE. It converts
 Tau-Ph(Ph is P in offset domain) gathers to Time-Offset gathers
 
 P-values (input) and offsets (output) are BOTH kept in header word 6.
 P-values have units of MICROSECONDS per unit distance and offsets
 replace P-values on output.
 
 If P values are used from the offset header (header 6), P values must
 monotonically increase or decrease. If the P values are not used from the
 header, user needs to define the range of P values.
 
 PH2OFF accepts a CPS velocity file and allows only one of the velocity type:
 'VTNM', 'VTRM','VTAV'and 'VTIN'.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                            ADVICE FOR USERS
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date       Author       Description
     ----       ------       -----------
003. 2006-10-16 D. Glover    Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
002. 2006-01-10 B. Menger    Removed Unused Variables.
 1  2005-01-31  S. Chiu      Original version
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
